title: Fort Wayne Flash
text:
The Fort Wayne Flash was a full-contact women's outdoor football team of the <a href="Women%27s%20Football%20Alliance">Women's Football Alliance</a> based in <a href="Fort%20Wayne%2C%20Indiana">Fort Wayne, Indiana</a>. The team started its exhibition season in 2006 and officially became part of the <a href="National%20Women%27s%20Football%20Association">National Women's Football Association</a> and began playing league games in 2007. Home games for the 2008 season were played at Bishop John M. D’Arcy Stadium on the <a href="University%20of%20Saint%20Francis%20%28Indiana%29">University of Saint Francis</a> campus, however, starting in 2009, the team played on the campus of Woodlan Senior/Junior High School in nearby <a href="Woodburn%2C%20Indiana">Woodburn</a>.
In 2008, the Flash clinched their first ever playoff berth and won the Midwest Division title. However, their playoff run was one-and-done, as they lost to the <a href="Columbus%20Comets">Columbus Comets</a> 14–7.
Beginning in 2009, the Flash played in the <a href="Women%27s%20Football%20Alliance">Women's Football Alliance</a>.
For 2010, the Flash were taking the season off to reorganize and cope with the death of player <a href="Karen%20O%27Boyle">Karen O'Boyle</a> and since then have never been heard of again.
Season-By-Season.
